page.title: 05 EAST RIDDLESDEN HALL
page.content: East Riddlesden Hall was first built in Saxon times and then it was rebuilt in 1638. It was first built by Archl a Saxon's son. The new part was built by James Murgatroyd. When East Riddlesden Hall was first built it was owned by Cos Patric who was Lord of Bingly. It was built to live in and it was the Lords Manor. Another reason for it to be built was that the Saxons thought that the hill and the water below were sacred. The owners now are the National Trust. There are no people living inside East Riddlesden Hall now. Mr. and Mrs Barker lived there until 1983 when they had a bungalow built next to it for themselves, so they could have more rooms open to the public.
